name: Banished
effect: The creature is removed from existance temporarily, and thus cannot take actions or be targeted by any abilities. This status cannot be continuous or permanent in duration without some other condition that allows the creature to return to reality.

name: Blinded
effect: Automatically fail attempts to see, increase difficulty to hit for attacks by 2

name: Boosted
effect: All Abilities that cost at least 2 AP cost 1 less AP

name: Charmed
effect: Creature regards the charmer as a friendly entity

name: Compel Truth
effect: Creature is unable to convey a known falsehood.

name: Confused
effect: Creature is unable to distinguish friend from foe. When that creature uses an ability that targets another, roll a d8 to indicate a direction with 1 being straight North. The creature targets the nearest creature to that direction.

name: Deafened
effect: Automatically fail attempts to hear

name: Dominated
effect: Creature cannot disobey the commands of the Dominator, whenever the creature receives an order against its self preservation, the original roll (attack or save) must be reattempted. If the attack misses/target saves on the reattempt, this status ends.

name: Doomed
effect: The creature dies at the start of the caster's turn.

name: Emotionally Manipulated
effect: The creature is manipulated to be currently feeling a specified emotion and acts accordingly.

name: Enraged
effect: The afflicted creature MUST make a damaging attack on each of its turns. If no enemy targets are available while the effect persists, the creature must target a friendly creature or object in its vicinity to deal damage to.

name: Enraptured / Fixated
effect: The afflicted creature must pay attention to and not move more than 10 squares away from the target of the enrapture specified when the status is applied.

name: Feared / Repelled
effect:
Creature cannot approach or attack source of fear/repel.
If feared by an ally, may not heal or bestow targeted buffs to the source of the fear.

name: Hidden
effect: The creature will not be noticed by other creatures unless they succeed an opposed Stealth(DEX) vs Perception(CUN) check or the creature performs an action that reveals itself. Gain +1 die to attack creatures that don't know where you are. See Stealth rules.

name: Hindered
effect: All Abilities that cost at least 1 AP cost 1 more AP

name: Hyper-accelerated
effect: When the creature takes a move action or has movement applied to it, it may only move the maximum amount possible and in a straight line.

name: Intangible
effect: The creatureâ€™s movement is not impeded by physical objects

name: Invisible / Undetectable (Sense)
effect: The creature cannot be detected using the specified sense, such as sight, sound, touch, thermal, smell, etc.

name: Isolated
effect:
Creature may not benefit from any duration-based buff effects bestowed to them by allies or bestow buff effects to allies. 
Buff effects the creature bestows to itself are unaffected.

name: Marked
cost:
10 xp to apply
-50 xp when required
effect: By itself, this status does nothing, but it allows other abilities to require it to activate more cheaply.

name: Muted
effect: The creature cannot make any audible sounds.

name: Panicked
effect: Target creature makes audible sounds of distress and must make at least one move action in a random direction where they move their full movement allowance in haphazard manner, but will avoid any terrain hazards they are aware of.

name: Prone
effect: The creature is laying on the ground and must spend 1 AP to stand but provoke attacks of opportunity, or 2 AP to stand up without provoking any attack. While prone, a creature may still move, but treats their ground speed as 1. Lasts until the target spends the AP

name: Revealed
effect: Creature is unable to benefit from Stealth, Invisibility, Subtle, or similar effects. Any of these effects present are immediately ended, and the benefits of the Subtle Extra are temporarily supressed.

name: Sealed
effect: The creature may only spend AP to move

name: Silenced
effect: Cannot use Active Abilities that cost class resources to activate.

name: Sleep
effect: The creature is asleep and may not take any actions that require being conscious, and ends any concentration effects. If the creature takes any damage, receives any healing, or is roused via a 2 AP action they wake up and lose this status.

name: Taunted
effect: Creatures must attack the taunting creature with any attack or debuff rolls it makes. It cannot target creatures other than the taunting creature.

name: Terrified
effect: Creature cannot target enemies with abilities or attacks. It may aid allies as normal.

name: Unconscious
effect: Creature is unable to perform any action that requires being conscious. Creature can be restored via a 4 AP action to rouse.

name: Unguarded / Unaware
effect: Damage to this target becomes a critical hit but removes this status from the damaged creature and any of its allies who notice the attack

name: Wide Open
effect: Any Action this creature takes that consumes AP provokes attacks of opportunity from threatening creatures, these attacks do not cost AP

name: {CHAR} Dice Down
effect: Decrease dice rolled with one CHAR

name: {CHAR} Dice Up
effect: Increase dice rolled with one CHAR

name: {Group} Damage Dealt Down
effect: Reduce damage dealt of a damage group. All groups are considered the same for scaling.

name: {Group} Damage Dealt Up
effect: Increase damage dealt of a damage group. All groups are considered the same for scaling.

name: {Group} Damage Taken Down
effect: Reduce damage taken of a damage group. All groups are considered the same for scaling.

name: {Group} Damage Taken Up
effect: Increase damage taken of a damage group. All groups are considered the same for scaling.

name: {Type} Damage Dealt Down
effect: Reduce damage dealt of a specific type, other than True damage. All types are considered the same for scaling (e.g. -2 fire and -2 force costs the same as -4 fire)

name: {Type} Damage Dealt Up
effect: Increase damage dealt of a specific type. All types are considered the same for scaling (e.g. +2 fire and +2 force costs the same as +4 fire)

name: {Type} Damage Taken Down
effect: Reduce damage taken of a specific type, other than True damage. All types are considered the same for scaling (e.g. -2 fire and -2 force costs the same as -4 fire)

name: {Type} Damage Taken Up
effect: Increase damage taken of a specific type. All types are considered the same for scaling (e.g. +2 fire and +2 force costs the same as +4 fire)

name: AC Down
effect: Reduce the difficulty to hit the target

name: AC Up
effect: Increase the difficult to hit the target

name: Accuracy Down
effect: When the target makes an attack roll, reduce the successes. When the target forces a save, reduce the DC

name: Accuracy Up
effect: When the target makes an attack roll, increase the successes. When the target forces a save, increase the DC

name: All Damage Dealt Down
effect: Reduce all damage dealt. True damage is only affected by the -100% modifier.

name: All Damage Dealt Up
effect: Increase all damage dealt.

name: All Damage Taken Down
effect: Reduce all damage taken. True damage is only affected by the -100% modifier.

name: All Damage Taken Up
effect: Increase all damage taken.

name: AP Gain Down
effect: Reduce AP generated at start of turn

name: AP Gain Up
effect: Increase AP generated at start of turn

name: Healing Down
effect: Decrease healing target receives. Negative healing deals true damage instead of healing.

name: Healing Up
effect: Increase healing target receives

name: Movement Down
effect: Reduce all movement speeds

name: Movement Up
effect: Increase all movement speeds

name: ReRoll Down
effect: Once per roll, re-roll successful dice. May not re-roll dice that have already been re-rolled.

name: ReRoll Up
effect: Once per roll, re-roll failed dice. May not re-roll dice that have already been re-rolled.
